Watch again: Draghi on the importance of maintaining multilateralism https://t.co/ERU9F1xJYa

Watch again: Draghi says the euro is irreversible https://t.co/mjjzW8SSNy

Pateicamies @LatvijasBanka par šīsdienas Padomes sanāksmes sarīkošanu!

Our thanks go to @LatvijasBanka for hosting this Governing Council meeting! https://t.co/zZJB7nfKsl
Draghi: The macroeconomic projections do not contain the effects of trade measures that have not been implemented yet. The direct consequences have been limited so far
Draghi: We’ll discuss reinvestments [of maturing bonds] at a future meeting. It’s an important discussion. We have to be mindful of the excess liquidity conditions.
Draghi: The intention of our interest rate formulation is to give it a time dimension, but not a precise one
De Guindos: In order to have a level playing field we need to make progress in terms of consistency in insolvency regulation
Draghi: Overall result of low interest rates has been vastly positive

Draghi: The discussion on keeping interest rates at their present levels through summer 2019 does not imply that the savers are being denied of their income and interest because savers can invest in other assets and they have done so
Draghi: The euro is irreversible because it’s strong, because people want it and because it is not of any interest to anybody to discuss its existence
Draghi: We have 19 countries, we are bound to have 19 elections at some point in time. What is important is that these differences are discussed within the existing treaties
Draghi: There is the collective intention of the Governing Council to avoid any unwarranted tightening of financial conditions
Statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/meqkl7yJ4U
Draghi: General character of the discussion was to remain to be patient, prudent and persistent and this was unanimously confirmed
Draghi: The decision was a unanimous one
Draghi: We did not discuss if and when to raise interest rates

Draghi: Improving the functioning of Economic and Monetary Union remains a priority and the Governing Council urges specific and decisive steps to complete the banking union and the capital markets union
Draghi: The implementation of structural reforms in euro area countries needs to be substantially stepped up
Draghi: June 2018 Eurosystem staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area foresee annual HICP inflation at 1.7% in 2018, 2019 and 2020

Draghi: Underlying inflation is expected to pick up towards the end of the year and thereafter to increase gradually over the medium term, supported by our monetary policy measures, continuing economic expansion, corresponding absorption of economic slack, rising wage growth

Draghi: Uncertainties related to global factors, including the threat of increased protectionism, have become more prominent, the risk of persistent heightened financial market volatility warrants monitoring
Draghi: The risks surrounding the euro area growth outlook remain broadly balanced
Draghi: June 2018 Eurosystem staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area foresee annual real GDP increasing by 2.1% in 2018, 1.9% in 2019 and 1.7% in 2020
Draghi: The latest economic indicators and survey results are weaker, but remain consistent with ongoing solid and broad-based economic growth

Draghi: The Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments as appropriate to ensure that inflation continues to move towards the Governing Council’s inflation aim in a sustained manner

Draghi: Today’s monetary policy decisions maintain the current ample degree of monetary accommodation that will ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation towards levels that are below, but close to, 2% over the medium term

Draghi: We expect the key ECB interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the summer of 2019 and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure that the evolution of inflation remains aligned with our current expectations of a sustained adjustment path

Draghi: We intend to maintain our policy of reinvesting the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the APP for an extended period of time after the end of our net asset purchases, and in any case for as long as necessary

Draghi: We anticipate that, after September 2018, subject to incoming data confirming our medium-term inflation outlook, we will reduce the monthly pace of the net asset purchases to €15 billion until the end of December 2018 and then end net purchases
Draghi: We will continue to make net purchases under the APP at the current monthly pace of €30 billion until the end of September 2018
Draghi: A sustained convergence of inflation towards our aim will be maintained even after a gradual winding-down of our net asset purchases

Draghi: With longer-term inflation expectations well anchored, the underlying strength of the euro area economy and the continuing ample degree of monetary accommodation provide grounds to be confident that sustained convergence of inflation towards our aim will continue
Draghi: The Governing Council concluded after a careful review that progress towards a sustained adjustment in inflation has been substantial so far
Watch ECB press conference live: President Mario Draghi explains today’s monetary policy decisions https://t.co/BGX2M9vcjj

The Governing Council held its annual external monetary policy meeting at @LatvijasBanka in Riga today. Follow the live webcast of the press conference here on Twitter from 14:30 CET. https://t.co/hbD6dhppxC

Cœuré: Fostering financial literacy at an early age would help central banks communicate their increasingly complex policies to the general public. It is a precondition for rebuilding trust, which is the foundation of central bank independence. 8/8
Cœuré: However, growing complexity presents challenges which go beyond the remit of a central bank. Citizens need to be equipped with the knowledge to understand central banks’ mandates and tasks. 7/
Cœuré: Another example is our “Back to School” programme, which involves our staff going out to speak in schools, in particular the schools they themselves attended. 6/
Cœuré: The ECB is embracing a more differentiated communication strategy. Our website features explainers which describe complex issues in an accessible way https://t.co/Cno0IQ29e8 5/
Cœuré: If we are to be fully accountable, central banks need to broaden their outreach and explain why it matters what central banks do. 4/
Cœuré: This growing complexity poses a challenge for central banks in terms of their outreach and their accountability to the general public. 3/
Cœuré: As a result of the crisis, central banks’ toolkits have become much more complex. 2/

(THREAD) At an event marking 350 years of the @riksbanken, Executive Board member Benoît Cœuré reflects on central banking in times of complexity. Read the full speech here https://t.co/2SxvXtXREY 1/ https://t.co/G9JchnxuQs
